case_title: MUJAHID HUSSAIN NAQVI vs AZAD GOVERNMENT OF THE STATE OF JAMMU & KASHMIR
court_name: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Service Tribunal
respondent: Azad Government of the State of Jammu & Kashmir

summary.appeal_basis: Appellant challenged removal from service under section 4 of the Service Tribunals Act, 1975.
summary.rules_invoked: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Civil Servants (Efficiency and Discipline) Rules, 1977

key_points.commission_inquiry: Commission of Inquiry No. 2 was set up under section 3 of the Commission of Inquiries Act, 1955.
appellant_defense: Denied all charges as baseless and untrue.
Argued lack of reasonable opportunity to show cause.
key_points.tribunal_findings: None of the charges against the appellant were proven.

decision.reinstatement: Appellant reinstated into service with all consequential benefits.
decision.income_deduction: Income earned from legal practice to be deducted from emoluments.

legal_references: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Civil Servants (Efficiency and Discipline) Rules, 1977
